one_reviews_text: Game looks great and runs great until it just crashes a minute or two in. As far as I know nothing can be done.

One of the few demos that actually is worth a look. Graphics are ok-ish, and there is actually a bit of a gameplay with is more than I can say for other demos. Works fine on my Quest 2 via AirLink. Would like to see more polished graphics, this looks a bit PS2-like.

Human models are not perfect but the lightning, Neon lights, wierd futuristic commercials and amazing rendered city make you feel like you are in the city. Very good VR beginner game. Highly suggested for newbies.

review_title: Amazing.  I would pay for a full version
one_reviews_text: This is amazing.  I wish somebody made a full version game like this.  The 3D captured actors looked really good too.  I've never seen that in any other game.  I love futuristic cities.  It would be my dream if someone made an open world futuristic city RPG like this.  This looks so much better than Cyberpunk 2077 because it's actually futuristic.

I found this an entertaining experience.  The visuals are pretty good, and it has an interesting concept.  As a fan of the original Blade Runner I enjoyed this brief dive back into that world.  It's little more than a tech demo and movie promo though.

review_title: A must for any Bladerunner fan!
one_reviews_text:
There is a recognizable character, in game, that has to be based on the looks of Philip K. Dlck. He originally wrote "Do Androids Dream of Electric Sleep" which Bladerunner was based on. The infomat said the character is 52. PK Dlck died at age 53. Chills.
This short game is too popular -too good- to just be left the way it is, lost - like tears in the rain. It has to return in some form. From the perfectly recreated Spinner (air car) flying in the rain to the holographic like guide that helps you during the game, you'll be agape through this entire adventure.

review_title: Looking for Part 1 or 3? Read this.
one_reviews_text:
Blade Runner 2049: Replicant Pursuit is Part 1; it was supposed to be on Rift also, but is only on Go and Gear VR :(

There was also a Part 3 planned, according to VRfocus.com:
"Created by Turtle Rock Studios, this is actually the first of three Blade Runner VR experiences with two more due to be released prior to Blade Runner 2049’s release later this year. These will be coming to both Gear VR and Oculus Rift."

Full article here:
 https://www.vrfocus.com/2017/07/oculus-unveils-blade-runner-2049-replicant-pursuit-for-samsung-gear-vr/

review_title: Ok game...just wish there was more
one_reviews_text:
So, I can't totally knock this app because it *was* free.....
So right off that bat, I kinda knew and felt there wasn't much to this app, and I was right.

It always pretty good, but I wish there was more to it.

This will keep you busy for 15-20 minutes. It's a good time killer of you need roughly a half hour to kill. :)

One of the best/better "free" apps I've downloaded in my opinion tho. :)
A very nice experience. But if this is part 2, where is part 1? Because it is so nice, it is too short. :)

Too short !
Good ambiance.
Is it a game at work ?
This is great to demo what VR can do.
Nice 3d Scannt charaters and a nice short trip in the Bladerunner univers.
big bladerunner fan and this was neat to play through, just wish there was a full length game. 3d hologram characters are pretty realistic aside from the minor artifacting.

This short experience has a very big potential for a full campaign.
I would just modify the controls so you don't have to press the joystick in the touch controllers because it can get a bit annoying.
Other than that it's a well designed experience which deserves a full game.

I've never seen people 3D scanned into a VR experience before. It's like they're actually there. The experience overall is not bad and it's more than I thought it would have been, but I would 100% recommend it for the 3D scanned characters.
Ran fine on the Rift S. If you liked Bladerunner, worth it just for the initial ride in the Spinner!
Amazing (short) experience. The characters and the world were so believable!
thisw looks like its gonna be baddassery more!!

I was only a marginal fan of the movie, but this experience takes the world depicted in Blade Runner 2409 and breathes amazing life into it with a creative short story that's both engaging and highly entertaining.

I . want. more.

Absolutely love this. Wonderful concept.

Not sure if the full game is available, but I'd deffo buy it. Really, really good if you love Bladrunner. So much love has gone into this. Download it now!

Super sense of immersion in an iconic locale. Excellent voice acting. Convinving AIs. Like everyone else, wish it was longer. Would definitely purchase something along these lines. Good degree of interaction for what is mainly a VR "movie." Close to feeling like a mini-game. Thanks for the fun!
High production value, good writing, place you right in the Blade Runner world. Wish this can be developed into a full game.
A glimpse into the future of how movies and story telling might be presented.  Really incredible experience.  Just wish it was longer.

Free Blade Runner 2049 VR experience!! 🤩🤩🤩
Also, **** this memory lab lady is hot, she's your partner in crime apparently 🤖😛
Please make this into a full game, but ditch the teleportation. I am sure people would pay for this experience. It would justify a kickstarter pledge.

Just blown away by this,really need a full blown game,i'm sure many,many player's would pay handsomely to see a "proper" game come from this,come on dev's,you know it make's sense.Oh,need more star's  to rate correctly.

It's a neat little demo, and would undoubtedly be a top tier experience if expanded into a full game. Some fun scenes to interact with and the scanning technology they have used to render the characters is fascinating! Could be a great technology in future, very intriguing.

This short demo displays some impressive technology. It would seem far more impressive with free movement—and the teleportation does GREATLY hinder the experience—but I was still more struck by the immersive possibilities of the mixed reality capture technology for the characters. Far too many Oculus games come in at a paltry few gigs, and it really shows in the detail and presentation. I believe much of the VR community is hungry for a huge game of deeply immersive detail and content and are more than willing to take the hit on their hard drives and bank accounts. Like many, I’m fed up with the cartoony nonsense pushed on the VR community. Unreal 4, paired with mixed reality capture and free movement, seems already poised to create a next gen experience.

Much like others have said, this deserves a full game and it's a shame teleportation still exists in VR.

A decent movie tie-in but again, a lost opportunity for something more.
When this becomes a full game I for one will be happy to part with cash. For what it is, a taster, it's very polished.

This is a really great interactive short demo.
Playtime about half an hour, but worth every minute.
This would be a perfect full adventure title for sure.

(Played with HTC Vive Cosmos on ReVive)
As a tie in to Blade Runner 2049 it fits right in. It offers a short but fun glimpse into the movie world. As a free "demo" it's definitely worth a try.

This exploratory experience (it really is more of an experience than a game, as such) is visually astounding, making use of some brilliant motion capture and some awesome looking graphics that make use of the BR2049 world. However, it's just far too short - it feels like it should be perhaps a 'first episode' or a teaser for a full title, and it ends rapidly without much of an explanation for the whole thing, and a rushed effort to tie the events you're investingating together. My only other criticism is the method of locomotion - I really hate teleportation, it's such an un-natural way of moving about and it feels like the one thing that really breaks the illusion of this otherwise 10/10 VR experience. That aside, I very much hope the creators of this release a stack more in the same style!! An hour or two worth of this format would easily justify a £15-20 game. But for free, you can't fault this one. Five stars for sure. Thanks to the devs!
We need more of this quality in vr,graphics are great,immersion is wonderful!
But now I using oculus quest, but no show in quest store, I hope can put it in store too

review_title: Such a great start/Please make it happen
one_reviews_text: I would totally love to see a continuation of this game. Maybe kickstart it for the true fans of the world?
review_feedback: We have the same excitement! Thanks for the review UniCronStudios!

one_reviews_text: I've been a fan of blade runner almost my whole life and I feel like this game captured the atmosphere and visuals of that world perfectly.

Absolutely loved the volumetric live capture for this short but great example of what VR can be. Unlike many other VR shorts that have live capture, you can actually walk around these characters and I feel that added even more to the environment. Having options for locomotion would be a great addition, but the rotate in teleport worked well. If something like this can be turned into a full blown game it would be amazing.

review_title: Best VR game ever but too short
one_reviews_text: I understand how hard it is to make VR games but this really needs to be longer. The second I stepped in it was like I was in the memory lab and the whole use of mocap is amazing. When I got to the ending I though we were just getting started but then the credits started rolling and I was very dissapointed but in a good way. They game and its story is amazing but thinking the game was just getting started then having it end was a let down. Absolutley still worth 5 stars though.
review_feedback: Thanks Gordon!  We're hoping there's a lot more of this coming in the future. :)

one_reviews_text: Very nice experience
review_feedback: We agree with you XinBalasVR. Please try out some of our other experiences out on the market.

review_title: Sound seems to be bugged out
one_reviews_text: No ambient sound at all. So creepy, and not in a good way. Plus it's just hella boring. Not worth your time.
review_feedback: Sorry that the experience seems boring. We've included ambient sound FX, so if you're not hearing it please uninstall and re-install as the download process could've been slightly problematic. If you're so inclined, please try out some of our other experiences.

one_reviews_text: basically you scan a couple things and then press a button and then boom, before you know it, the game is over. Wtf did I just play? There is 15 min of my life I will never get back...
review_feedback: We're sorry you feel this way about the experience. We've introduced new technology in three dimensional volumetric capture of real life people and integrated those assets into our experience. If you're so inclined, please try out some of our other experiences out on the market.

one_reviews_text: The producers have really put together a top notch game, truly worthy of the Blade Runner name.  Better than the Blade Runner remake movie.  At certain points in the game I felt like I was there, right there on the street.  I wanted to just stretch my arms out and feel the space.  The game was easy and well guided, no frustration what so ever.  Also with room scale you could kind of walk around outside of the limits of set game parameters.  You could touch and examine people and things, just not interact with them.  All they need to do now is take this one step further with more interactivity and they could reach a whole new level of vr gaming.

Like many said before the car ride is fun and then the first memory read but after that it kind of looses its appeal.

Edit: In response to Developers: Don't get me wrong, I liked it but I think I would like it more if I would be taken to some memorable places like Deckards flat from original BR or Vegas Cassino from BR 2049.
review_feedback: Thanks for the review!  Personally we felt the second memory was better than the first, and exploring the alleyway was another fun moment. But regardless, glad you got into it and tried it out. :)

one_reviews_text: About a 20min playthough. It's free so I figured was worth a go. Interesting.
Want a full game please!
review_feedback: Us too!

one_reviews_text: Not rly into the witchhunt. Definetly appreciated the detail of the alleyway memory. If you could make an actual game with this environment you would have me sold.
review_feedback: Thanks!  We agree.  This is really kind of a sampler of what’s to come when there’s enough people with headsets out there to justify going big. :). Less witch hunt though for sure.

one_reviews_text:
The car sequence is nice, graphics look good and then the memory recall thing starts and around there it crashes. On high graphics settings as soon as the pillar turns round, on low settings, I can view a bit of a memory then it crashes. Also, the view has a weird vignette at the bottom, like they cropped it to a small screen rather than using the full oculus view. 
(2xGTX1070 SLI, 24GB RAM, quad core i5 3.4Ghz)
review_feedback: Sorry to hear you're having a bad trip, Max.  By chance can you tell us what OS and Nvidia drivers you're on?  Sounds like it's crashing when it hits the volumetric video, which is usually an OS/drivers thing.  Thanks for the specs, and happy holidays!  hello@magnopus.com

review_title: Looks really good but is crashing
one_reviews_text:
Looks really good but it crahed in the memory sequence where you meet the other guys in some cave\sewer. 

-Windows 10
-Radeon RX 480
-System Model: Dell XPS 8500
-Processor(s):  Intel Core i5-3350P @ 3.10GHZ (4Cores)
-Ram: 16GB
review_feedback: Thanks for the information!  We'll work to chase that down.  We used a very early build of the volumetric video that gets a little complicated (unstable) with some hardware.

one_reviews_text: Such an amazing feeling to be inside of the blade runner universe.
review_feedback: We thought so too!  We even put the visual effects supervisor of the original Blade Runner movie in the experience while we were working on it, to get his feedback and he stayed there a long time, and said it was just like being on the set again. :). Glad you liked it.

one_reviews_text: One of the better 3D Movies. But bad Actors.
review_feedback: Glad you enjoyed it!  One of the tricky things for our poor actors is that capturing them with volumetric video requires putting them in a green room and surrounding them with 100+ cameras.  And we captured them before we had the environments or the story fully developed so that wasn't helping them.  We think we can help the actors more in the future and our subsequent work with volumetric video has been more successful in this regard.

one_reviews_text: The windows OS is not supported..
review_feedback: Please let us know what Windows OS version you're on. We may be able to help you install and play our experience. Thanks for the review.

one_reviews_text: Liked how it begin but it started crashing.
review_feedback:
Sorry to hear that!  Can you email us your computer specs so we can try to troubleshoot?  CPU, GPU, OS, etc.  would be great.  Thanks and happy holidays! 
hello@magnopus.com

one_reviews_text: Entertaining interactive trailer that starts well with an atmospheric rainswept approach (bar the seat textures). Satisfies that desire to wander down a Blade Runner street. Great lab face. Predictable ending.
Good experience.
not for inpacent gamers.
review_feedback: Sorry you feel this way about our experience. Please try out our other experiences on the market and we'll be thankful for the constructive feedback. We appreciate your review.

one_reviews_text: Sooo much crashing for what is essentially just a bloated movie.  There is nothing in this that should scream for such high specs, other than bad (inefficient) use of code. Even managed to BSOD once. You know how long it has been since I've seen a BSOD?!?!

Navigation is a little confusing. It doesn't always point you in the direction you se the arrow - close but not exact.  And easy to get a little lost in the street. Knocking a star for no EXIT menu - hate having to remove the headset to hit ALT-F4.

this was amazing and made me actually feel like i was in 2049 LA but my one problem with it was that the expirience was way too short and the end came too suddenly 
*SPOILERS*
so basically you are being sent to be retired for killing some guy you modify the scene of the murder then you find out he was an employee of the wallace corporation you then meet wallace who tells you you have done well then it just ends there i would have loved to have seen more of Wallace

The street scene was the highlight absolutely beautiful and i forgot i was in my headset for a second if you could release that one street section as a standalone tech demo that would be awesome
Give it a go
This is a good example of the right direction for this medium. Hope there is much more to come.
This needs to be a full game. My favorite VR experience so far!
review_feedback: We agree!

one_reviews_text:
Reading the other reviews I'm slightly confused as to the reasons some only gave it 1 or 2 stars. This is quite exceptional, the character modelling/animation is top notch, probably the best I've encountered in VR to date. The setting is also interesting, albight a tease. I'd really like this to be made into a full game, I'd definately buy it.

The story approach is short, yes, but again I took it as a teaser, not a statement. It tells me a lot about what these developers are capable of and I know if they took it further into something bigger, they'd do an excellent job as it's quite impressive. Whether they will or not (as such a thing is a big undertaking) is unknown, but I really hope they do. A fully fledged Blade Runner epic of this class would be spectacular.
An awesome experience! A five star movie and a five star VR experience!

Well worth the download even if it is a limited demo. Once you experience this, youll be asking when is the full version available for purchase. 

Looking forward to the full release

SteamVR with mixed reality and revive

HMD Odyssey - Windows Mixed Reality Headset
EVGA GeForce GTX 1080 Ti FTW3 GAMING, 11G-P4-6696-KR, 11GB GDDR5X, iCX Technology

review_feedback:
Hey that's a good question!  
We think it'd be cool too.
...Fingers crossed.

one_reviews_text:
The detective stuff wasn't interesting, but the world is beautiful. Maybe it should have just been a walking simulator? 

But others are complaining that it wasn't enough of a game, and I'm complaining that it's too much of one, so you can't win, really.

Amazing "experience" showcasing a futuristic Blade Runner-esque environment populated with scanned actors. Don't expect a game, but a short-story with set-pieces while you go on and you'll be more than satisfied.

Grading this app is very difficult, because it depends on what you expect. First to mention is that the graphics and the VR experience is really great and high quality. The characters move and speak very naturally you have to look twice. But the game is not really a game, actually, it's even boring as nothing really happens.  It's more a walking and looking around until it suddenly stops as if it's just a preview for a game. So it's only one story, one level. If you play again, you play the same story. What bothers me is that you cannot skip the tutorial part. Even being very short, they should add some spots to step in the game.
If games in VR are going to be as bloated like this with so little playability.  Might be worth selling off my Oculus.
For the VR Enthusiast, this is a must have. It contains the most realistic human animation within VR that I have ever seen. If you have lots of download space, give it a go!

A fantastic small snippet of The Blade Runner 2049 Earth, conveying the atmosphere of the film beautifully, -and very immersive. I was left wanting more of the same. Make this into a full game and I`ll buy it immediately.

This is the way a VR movie advertisement should be made. This is a high quality hype machine for the movie. well done! The bar has been set that all movie VR experiences need to meet or exceed from here on.

One of the better free movie promotions in vr. The characters feel very alive due to the fact that they seem to be motioned captured. 
I enjoyed myself the most at the very start when you are flying in the car. In the story itself there isn't much to do except for the things they tell you. There is a little bit of Neon Tokyo to explore though.
If you as well enjoyed the scenery the most I recommend this independent project "Blade Runner 9732" on steam. It's Deckard's apartment, complete with a stunning view.
I waited until having seen the film and boy was I disappointed with the VR experience - totally vacuous. Even the car ride at the start was shallow. Urgh.

A lot of the visuals were beautiful, especially the opening ride in the rain, and the voice acting was great. I liked the atmosphere and the sense of dread you stared to feel since retirement here doesn't involve a cake and gold watch. I was pleasantly surprised to get a full game over twenty minutes in length compared to the several minute intro I expected.

It showcases a really good new technology, and the environments are really well done.

Much work has been thrown here, and it's highly appreatiated.

There are a number of expectations that this experience makes of the user, some of which are not realistic and throw you out of the immersion when you break script. The holograms by MS are not great... it seems like there's been a lot of progress in lots of areas and MS is falling behind. Essentially, it's kinect tech, which is cool stuff, but not good for hologram capture and display.

People need to understand that this is FREE and its just a demonstration of the holographic technology. This is probably the future of entertainment, if you imagine the possibility of watching a movie that you can actually walk in the scene and view it from every angle you wish. We need more of this and faster! Btw it needs a fast pc and windows 10. You dont have give it 1 star because you and your pc sucks... idiot

Cool little dive into the Blade Runner world in VR, with some minor little detective puzzles to solve too. Throw some cash at this thing and flesh it out into a full game and I'd pay a bunch of cash, but for free this is a nice wee offering too.

Looked incredible, I love the 3d video capture they're using. And they designed the content around the limitations of the technology very well. 

However, the acting is pretty cruddy. It just feels like a tex murphy adventure game. Where the pacing and delivery is all just slightly off. Enough to make you feel like you're watching a play instead of a cinematic experience.
I would certainly recommend experiencing it anyway.
I look forward to more being done with this tech.

Great experience for the price, the gameplay felt gimmicky but better than a watch only experience.  Only other complaint is it tells me to face the oclulus sensors even though I am playing in a 360 setup.
Enjoyed it even before seeing the movie. I prefer it to the Ghost in the Shell counterpart. Good use of Photogrammetry.
Can by beter

When I ran the game you can bet I was excited, but its simply ridden with glitches and loading screens, I stood in the middle of my room longer than I did anything else. Unfourtunetly for me entire sprites were missing and charictors wouldnt even show up, there was blood spilling out of nothing?? Either way I would still give it a shot, maybe on diffferent hardware it will run, after all a free vr game is a free vr game

cannot play this because of windows 10, when i want microsoft to know when i watch adult movies and where on my harddrive its located, then i wil give it a try xD
____________________________________________________________________________________________
After watching the Awesome movie:
Can you guys make this work on Windows 7 as well? perhaps use Vulcan instead of DX12 windows 10 nonsence
Really good VR experience, the only downfall is the end of it.

It captures the essence of the movie, but only really at the very very surface. The finding clues with the scanning of the people is very repetitive and boring. On a positive side, the environment is well executed from the very beginning. I just was expecting something more.
I hope this gets converted into a full Blade Runner type VR game!

Totally captures the dark feel of the movie although it is teleport based it is pretty smooth. Add the features of robo recall and get a longer story and this demo will take off ! Obviously it is short and very limited but a great glimpse into what a futuristic Crime Noir might be : )

I feel like the technology isn't really there yet.. for 3d scanned performances that is. If I moved a little bit to the side the woman would not stare straight at me anymore. This took me out of the experience and I was no longer there. I was just an observer. So, IMO, using 3d scanned humans as npc's is not the way to go in interactive experiences, for now.  I think getting eye contact is really important. I mean, I felt more immersed in half life when it came out. The characters feel more real there and that game is what, 10+ years old? Sheesh. So no, the tech isn't there yet. Scanning a human in 3d and putting them in your game/experience is not enough to make them feel human. To make them feel human you have to make them interact with the player, have eye contact and what have you. Making them have eye contact while you stand still like a stiff pole doesn't count. This might still work for movie like experiences where the "player" is an observer but not for interactive experiences like this. And on a sidenote, I felt more immersed in Aircar than in this. They should've teamed up with that guy and made a full Bladerunner game. One could dream.

Just like the Ghost in the Shell experience, it takes a neat concept and framework and places a very mediocre interactive experience at the core. It could have been much more interesting, but it shines through as a barebones marketing vehicle.
Pretty short for the size but it packs a lot of details. It was cool to move around 3D people that were so detailed.
Thanks for the free look into Blade Runner VR. Short and sweet.

I like this game. A bit complicated with the movements and controllers at first. Though just getting used to it, the game comes to an end with the guy in the chair  who is envious of you after completing your task. I was hoping for more. But with the 'free' demo what more can you ask for? It's great and well thought of. Let's hope that developers can make it bigger and better in the future!

Enjoyed it, but its one of those one time views, think there could be a great concept with the Holo Chick though. We need one in the occulus room to greet us like Siri does and interact with comands. Oculus team look into this please..lol
I enjoyed it a lot. The only falw would be the light flares, with so many dark places and neon lights, it bother me some times. Not much though, great experience!
As a movie teaser, it's not very long. However, the short time you do get is very well done; this is the best movie tie-in VR experience I've used!

To the previous reviewer: Technology does not move forward in one great leap. It advances in many baby steps. I agree that technology seems to move slowly at times, but I see a major progression from the static figures in Technolust (from which this clearly draws inspiration) to the full-motion avatars seen in this game. I am also looking forward to the days of full eye contact, combined with artificial intelligence that can respond to the player's actions in real time, as well as voice recognition and the ability of NPCs to respond to the player's spoken statements, but I recognize that it will take a while. In the meantime, this as a definite step forward.
Its great for fans of the films or just VR gamers alike.
This experience was pretty cool. Not the most exciting but had some good visuals and pushed the photogrammetry on characters further than I've ever seen before.

Come on!!! You made me download 12+ GB for this stuff!!!
The girl in the place of the hands seems to have the mittens, where they have drawn their hands above!
The extra star is because it's free

I do hope they eventually turn this in to a full game, but without sacrificing the quality for space. I loved the demo, it kept me busy and interested without boring me and these days that's hard as i've lost interest in my VR gear. Keep em coming. No jitter as previous people reported, no frame loss or lag, the demo ran flawlessly with 2.0 super sampling in oculus tray tool.

This is a short interactive experience. But it is an exiting example of how far photogrammetry has come in VR. It provides a glimpse into the future of VR story telling. Now someone just needs to take this and make a Tex Murphy VR game. :) Anyhow. It is free and definitely a step in the right direction. I enjoyed it.
Nice side story to BR2049. I would recommend people see the films before watching this.
This game makes the Unreal Engine crash at the same point over and over again. Am unable to play it at all :(
we all waiting for a full VR game!

This is actually an experience - there is not much interactivity in it, and personally I would not need it in this experience.

This is what a VR movie could be like in the future, giving you the option to move around as a spectator for example.

There are no real "glitches" as someone else mentioned, it's just how the actors were recorded in 3D - not flawless, but it's just the beginning. I'll give this full stars, even, if it's not a game, and it's short. But it's free and it shows a very nice potential of future movies
are amazing! I wish, Oculus produce more like this Movies in future. The technologic is really impressive. Thanks!

Okay this will take longer to download and install than playing the game, i use the word game loosely. If you look at this as a future tech of 3d scanned real life acting, then this is it. I look forward to what the future holds for vr games and I can only hope movies.
Crashes after few minutes. Even re-install did not help

This "Experience" was 15GB of crappy looking VR.  The worst part was, that the experience lasted 10 mins, then it was over and you had to watch 5 mins of credits.   Even with an i7-7700k and a GTX 1080Ti and it running at "90FPS", it was jittery as hell.  I think this experience was something that came out years ago, and now it just looks super dated.  

Don't waste your time on this.  SKIP SKIP SKIP!
It's free, and it's decent. But title describes it.

review_title: Awesome experience, you end up wanting..
one_reviews_text: ...more. This starts really great, gives you a great story (even if short) and it does immerse you immediately into it and the environment. The human actors as 3d models are really good, even if from the side (which you actually don't get to see usually, unless you check intentionally) you see some details lacking (ie. no hole in the mouth), which are however not at all noticeable by default. Technically, it provides an amazing detail of the environment and of the graphics, surely done by using several strategies (like the lower polygon actor model which looks great) to achieve this. It advances into something you start thinking this is gonna be a full game, with a great and interesting interface. But then, it finishes when it reveals a great secret and you expect some more to come, not to finish right that moment. At that point it can be easily continued into a real game, after everything it already provided. That's the only mood point, that you want more after this, especially after downloading 15GB, you expect some more. But the experience, is otherwise done with great effort, great detail and awesome.

It's a fun free experience, but the teleportation was really buggy for me. Like RoboRecall, this game has you point the joystick to specify the direction you'll be facing after teleportation. Whenever I did that, though, it always faced me in the wrong direction.

The tech is neat, using recorded people on 3D models, but the experience is shallow, and maybe 15 min long.  I'm not sure it's worth the 11 gigs of download.  Sound design is pretty lacking too.  Characters sound like they were recorded in a break room.  Music and ambience wasn't very memorable.  Ran fine on my i5/8gb machine.

i cant understand why movie experienace like spiderman or now blade runner must be running under win 8 or win 10 .... its the same code ..everthing can run under win 7-10 ..why such a mess with the os ????
review_feedback: Unfortunately due to the use of Microsoft Holographic technology that enabled us to do photogrammetry captures of our actors and actresses the minimum requirement is windows 10. We are working directly with Microsoft to see if there is a way to bring this experience to both windows 8.1 and 7. Please be on the look out for update which may enable this option.

one_reviews_text: This is more of an experience than a game, that being said it is a beautiful experience. If they added more things to do you could very much turn this into a great full featured game. The characters are gorgeous and the animations aren't as bad as people are saying, I was very impressed with the concept and visuals behind this. It gave me great ideas for a game that I am currently working on.
crach evrey few minute also very larg size

If your old enough to remember FMV games (or holographic games, remember those?) in the 90's this brings that concept into the realm of VR. To me this was a great proof of concept. There are game mechanic gripes and some polish needed for this to actually be a game worth money but for what it was it was cool.

From a gameplay mechanic standpoint the only thing I would say they need to add for this type of game to be successfull is at least an option for free roam via the thumb stick rather than just point and click. I realize some people need point and click because its less likely to cause motion sickness (or to much for their rig) but its immersion breaking. It feels clunky and annoying as is. 

When the FMV actor looked at you, her eyes followed you pretty well, but there was some lattency if you adjusted your footing to a new postion. When it worked though it was awsome and made me feel like I was in the game.

I would love to see something like this as a murder mystery game...and have to admit while playing this, it made me almost have a flash back of playing a Tex murphy Advanture! Which I thought was awsome...and a bit ironic since it was satire of the oringal blade runner.
 
Give it a try, its worth 15min since its free but don't expect a full game.

review_title: Hopefully the start of something amazing
one_reviews_text:
Wow! As a big fan of the movie this was right up my alley. Really hoping for a full game sometime in the future.

It would require a really good story as well as additional and exciting game play elements of course, but the technology with live actors and VR certainly has a huge potential.

Bit on the short side and sort of forces less exploration than it should however characters are very good.

Nice and clean.

Gives the vibe of a place rather well.
Ties into the story properly. 

I just wish there would be more freedom in the exploration.

Would recommend seeing the movie first but it's not really spoiler material.

Marry this company up with air car and then we're talking!!!! Good tech demo, glitchy movement and loss of eye contact with main character which breaks the immersion, BUT! This is all new and hope for great things to come in the future! A Noble effort!

It looks very good, the ambience is amazing and the characters look very real, but the game is not optimized at all, so it takes a lot of time to load, sound gets desynced with the characters and even if all those issues were fixed, going around "finding flaws" feels like a chore.

I guess if you're a fan of the Blade Runner world you will dig this. I found it so dull I didn't even finish. Basically a strangely animated holo woman gets you to wonder around an alleyway and point your laser at static objects to decode them.  Gameplay wise it's the same as Farlands. If you enjoy pointing at things and clicking on static objects to reveal information this will be right up your alley. If you prefer actual gameplay I'd not bother. Apparently this is a short 20 minute experience but it felt like twice as long and I couldn't bring myself to finish. If you're going to download a 10gb file to interact with an attractive hologram female I'd recommend Wankz VR or Badoink as offering a lot more entertainment than this.

Very cool experience. The characters are very high quality, although the acting was a little sub-par. This experience was a good mix of cinema and interactivity. Nothing hard, just allowing you to interact and modify the environment using cool tech. As this is free, there is no reason not to check out this app!

Otherwise meh. The first few minutes are really interesting and immersive. Then once you actually have to do something the task is mundane and pulls you out of the world. The world is sparse which is understandable given hardware limitations but sound could have been used much more effectively like the film and more interesting static images used. The only reason it gets 3 stars is because it initially pulls you in and give you a bit more of the Blade Runner world fans want. SPOILERS In the ended it leads to a climax of crap with a bad Jared Leto impersonation. The voice actor could have at least tried to immitate Wallace's odd way of speaking.

Has potential, but the experience was something in between a 360° video and actual VR and very short. The poor acting and unnatural 3D character animation as well as some low polygon geometry took me away from getting immersed, but the hologram was quite engaging although I still prefer 3D modelling for several reasons – not least because of gaze tracking.

review_title: Best free experience on Rift I had.
one_reviews_text: This is triple A quality. I watched the first Blade Runner and the three short films and now this, so I think I should see the new Movie now. I hope they make a game out of the assets they used to make this experience much like Epic Games did with the Showdown experience which they made Robo Recall with afterwards.

5 stars
because the ambient is awesome, 
in watching the movie you can't have the opportunity to see around, here is amazing.
The opportunity to be "there", in a street of LA 2019/49... wonderful.
I must admit that i'm a big fan, so for people who don't know or are not fan it can be only like an investigative game in a vr alternative 3d world.

Not sure what everyone else was playing but the game I downloaded had pretty poor graphics. All the player models are really low res and have really wierd artifacting. It looks like they have been thrown together using some wierd automated tool. The animations are jerky and it makes it look like the game is running at about 30fps. Not impressed at all I'm afraid.

I had really high expectations for this VR Blade Runner experience on Rift, as I really enjoyed the one on Gear VR.

As a matter of fact I was expecting something like Aircar (which I first thought was the VR Blade Runner experience for Rift).

Instead we get a lame investigation using the crappy teleportion system.

If you want a real Blade Runner experience on Rift, don't waste your time downloading this, instead take Aircar which is one of the best expereince I've ever done in VR !!!

review_title: Interesting movie tie in for free!
one_reviews_text: This is a short experience drawing on the recent Blade Runner 2049 release and it was certainly interesting enough to play it through to it's conclusion. Good looking graphics, interesting inclusion of holographic like images and showing again how imersive VR is. The gameplay is negligble in this relegated to simple scanning of a few items but the experience feels complete to the Blade Runner ethos. Good job and interested to see more movie/entertainment tie in's as well done or better than this one!

review_title: Amazing tech demo, everything else meh
one_reviews_text: So I give this demo 3 stars for the amazing technology (Microsoft Holographs, photogrammetry).  Very nice visuals on the human models.  However, everything else isn't as good.  Boring story.  Basic gameplay that is just doing tedious simple tasks.  You'll be scanning this area, then press a on the highlighted circle.  You will do this several times.  They payoff for doing said job is you get to do more of the same.  This demo is amazing to show the possibility of the future using this technology.  Disappointing that it was done so horribly wrong in this instance.  It's free, otherwise I would have given it one star.

A short and simple experience. It takes place in dark and futuristic urban environments. It's artistic and realistic. Importantly, the experience has real people that have been scanned in and are rendered in high quality. We're not used to seeing that yet. The experience involves really simple gameplay that isn't very interesting but brings the story forward. A side note: the developers responded to a questionable review here by saying they rated the reviewer 1 star as a human being. A very clear transgression and unprofessional behavior.

I love the Blade Runner universe and it couldn't keep me engaged until the end of what I am guessing is a very short experience. The acting was very stiff. Several of the environments were very beautiful, but the story telling and experience felt very forced and boring.

review_title: BIG potential, VERY good as a free demo!
one_reviews_text:
... and it was VERY clever to have an AI as virtual protagonist, so the (albeit small) animation glitches and lost eye contact don't break suspension of disbelief.
But all in all, if this is the future of VR entertainment: Color me fascinated!

review_title: Even though I crashed, I had fun!
one_reviews_text: I crashed, twice, I wish there was a way to skip the intro part so I didnt have to ride in the main sky car and listen to her speach each time it happened, maybe add a skip button? Otherwise, what a blast! I didn't get any nausea, graphics looked great! Thanks for the fun experience!
review_feedback: There is a way to skip the intro!  If you hold down the "A" button for 5 seconds it will skip.  Look to the right when holding it down and you will see an indicator to skip!

one_reviews_text: I enjoyed this short game. I'm really looking forward to the future of "4D" technology of pasting video of people over their 3D models.
City is much better in Aircar (also free app). Story is VERY short and finished in strange moment. Only plus of this "game" is interesting animation of people.
Pretty good for a free experience

...at least initially.
Best part of this demo is the beginning (sorry, no spoilers) however it then starts getting weaker until your left wanting more. This is a great freebie but I wish the concept could be expanded into a full game. It would be cool.

Fun experince 100% one of the better done movie based VR experinces. First time ive ever seen real humans used in VR rather than characters/anaimations very real looking! awesome experince!! A++ Oculus
When I boosted the settings, it was some of the best graphics i've seen on Oculus... A great mix of CGI and real video

The experience seems wonderful... for the first 3 minutes. Then when next scene starts the game crashes as soon as the machine that comes out of the floor rotates. Any fix coming for this? My specs are i5 7600k, GTX 1070, 16 GB ram, 1TB HDD, Windows 10

Human actors in cinematic VR. Very good graphics and attention to details. Makes you appreciate how powerful VR is and lets you wonder what can it offer in near future. However, I forgot about it just next day due to lack of any action.

As a huge fan of the original Blade Runner Movie. (Havent seen the new one yet.) And the Book, Do robots dream of electric sheep. This little snippet of another universe is more than enjoyable, even with how little there is there.

The real-time 3D scanned people are neat. But the rendering looks like some ancient version of Deus Ex with cheesy textures and no shadows, and the animation simply stopped for me in the first scene...the program was running, but I couldn't progress in the experience.
Pretty much it was really boring looked awful for a vr experience and had dumb mechanics soo yeah

Pretty solid. Good project. The intro to this was awesome and it deserved to be flushed out more. Oddly, I ended up enjoying it more than the main focal point of this interactive demo, which was very well done in it's self.

Awesome on high graphics settings, but it pushed my PC to the limit. I didn't notice any of the sound or video issues mentioned in other reviews. It captures the new movie's vibe in the limited area you explore

The captures are neat. The car was neat. Everything else was pretty bad. Positional audio was bad, acting was terrible, gameplay didn't realy exist.

If you want a more inspired cyberpunk VR experience, try AirCar and Technolust.

Boring Boring Boring
sorry i cant give it 0 stars
twice in the same place (well scene) now, don't wanna replay it from the beginning. (highest settings but 1.0 pixel density. Using Zotac Extreme Core no overclock. GPU temp only 60 C.)

its great to finaly be able to check out one of these cars from all sides, after being in it while flying!  the 3d characters (moving 3d scans) are cool! they came out good enough to feel like video. never saw such before!
I found it to be a well made production (can't call it too much of a game), with great graphics and sound, however what interaction exists is limited. An interesting tech demo and worth a look.

Good experience, worth checking out... reminded me a bit of those 1990's interactive cdrom games, similar overall vibe with up to date tech and a movie licence to back it up.  It's an promo ad, but also a cool tech demo.

Although GTX1080 and 16Gb was recommended, I thought I'd give it a go. 
It's free after all.
I was able to enjoy the experience with my GTX1060 and 8Gb. It ran well on default settings.
Nice looking experience.
Has nothing to do with the original Blade Runner movie

its seems to be  good experience , however i cant see anyone , i know there is a woman talking to me however i cant see her , nor can i see the video of the shooting and the animation dosnt appear , only the enviroment?????

I don't get it why people rate this 3 stars or less. I love the way this app is designed. If you love Bladerunner, give this a try! And even if you don't like Bladerunner this can still be a fine experience.

This actually better than alot of VR games out there and longer aswell (just gutted that Oculus haven't bitten the bullet and created a full game, this alone would've shifted more hardware than all the ad campaigns combined).

I cranked everything to the max and like someone else mentioned the graphics seem to be the best I've witnessed in VR. I only played like 5 minutes though. Does it save your progress or do you have to start over?

The first few minutes are great looking. all the interactive parts felt like a chore, and the story went nowhere. You can tell a good team was working on this, it took serious work. I just dont think it was fun.

review_title: Crappy mobile port, waste of disk space.
one_reviews_text: Graphics are crap, and worst of all, it doesn't teleport you where you pointed or in teh direction your arrow was. Utter trash. If I could rate zero I would. People actually made effort to make this which is the weirdest part.
review_feedback: We actually used a different engine and a different code base for each version of this experience.  I am sorry you were disappointed.   We at Alcon and Magnopus make the effort because we love the Blade Runner Universe and are always excited to extent it new stories and new media.

review_title: A taste of things to come?
one_reviews_text: Imagine if the Bladerunner game, made by Westwood back in the day, was created with this technology! This was a nice treat and I hope it inspires studios to make VR adventure games using a mix of FMV and CGI.
The volumetric video capture is amazing.  I give it 5 stars just for that.

Yea, a great little diversion. Probably 15-20 minutes but it's worth it. Enjoyed. 

Is it wrong to fancy that Holographic woman? ;-)
It was interesting, but it's insane that the download takes over 10GB for what you get.
If you like Blade Runner than you'll like this. It is Short but for a free experience I definitely enjoyed it!
It's good but the revolution is the realism of the characters. They are fully 3D digitalized actors in motion and that is unbelivable. The actors are really there. This is the future of VR.
Boring. Extra stars for being mildly entertaining and FREE
There's a lot of cool stuff going on here! The developers did a good job of recreating the world. Make sure to turn quality to "Best" if your machine can handle it!
The graphics are really nice. There isn't a ton of gameplay so I turned the graphics way up. Its short, but its free. Its really more of a short interactive movie but it shows the potential.
Surprisingly entertaining but not in the way you might think. Short and I wish it had elements from Aircar another VR title but I was impressed with the graphics and it left me wanting more.
One of the better experiences out there. Really high quality character models and lots of area to explore. It's free, no harm in trying it out.
I love the movie and now i can be in this world, but where is Joi?? ;) It's a nice little demo, but nothing more. Only for blade runenr 2049 fans.
Keeps crashing at the same point even with the lowest settings. Reinstallation doesnt fix it either.
Terrific inmersion, for those who already watched the film will feel familiar with the environment and places. Hope the developers release a full game in the future.
I have a 1070 and this keeps crashing and is very unstable. I suspect 1080 is minumum real usable specs. Shame very disapointing.
I wasent feeling it...
Worth the download, will leave you wanting more....
this is a decent dec demo for free, the graphics are really good when you max everthing out, some parts are the best ive seen on the rift, worth a look..
For what was essentially just a (barely) interactive story experience, the graphics were pretty rubbish.
disable that thing in your back that keeps saying yor sensors can'y see you. but oh wait??? they can! if you have 3 or more sensors..... pfff
One of the best free experiences on Occulus to date IMHO
A short experience about short people shorting out memories about a life cut short. This title will leave you short of breath.
Such a nice change from the endless shooting and blood on these platforms. Technically excellent and quite original.
Definitely you should try it!

review_title: Looks good for a moment then crashes
one_reviews_text: Not working properly. Just chrashes...
I don t know why , but it stucks, it stop ,,, and the imagage is stand still...???????

Plus: It's free, looks kinda nice.

Minus: Not a real "game", sloppy coding (graphical errors, dizziness).
Very good interactive experience. One of the best.
Great!!
Too short, but good. The quality is amazing though; Wallace's room is everything.
Cool to be in the Blade Runner world, but now I want more...
The game let's you be a part of the Blade Runner universe, fun and it's free.
Extraordinarily stupid writing, boring concept, total waste of the Blade Runner world.
I'd love to play this world as a full on game.. Huge potential

review_title: Really liked the movie / game mix
one_reviews_text: For a free game, it is a must! Especially if you saw the movie..
I know it's free but I've been waiting for this and it's such a let down.
Excellent short experience in the Bladerunner futuristic world!
stereo scaning technoligy is awsome, especially the lady engernior
This is a strong, amazing, piece of VR content. Highly recommend!
Very Short... but Love it
so short,,,so wonderful.  i will pay for the full game
It is a nice VR but it is very very short
A bit of fun nostalgia after seeing the film.
JUST WOW!!
Those real person models are pretty awesome!
Nice piece of art...
We want more!

@earlier comments talking about the woman characters physique: you should probably rate the game instead of people in it. (earlier slightly sarcastic way of pointing this out apparently wasn't understood)
review_feedback:
Hello! Speaking on behalf of all the developers who have worked so hard to make this a great experience, we didn't cast this woman so you could objectify her.  Being "hot" was not ever a design objective, and wouldn't have served the experience.  In return, we're also rating you 1 star as a human being.
Have a nice day!

one_reviews_text: The experience is well done and polished.  It's great to visit a city section as well with all the lights and detail. The scale and human character models look impressive, I think this is how future VR games should handle character modeling.  The over all experience is on the short side and leaves you wanting more. It also leaves you wanting to interact with a lot more things than you can.  I recommend it , even if you aren't a Blade Runner fan like me.  3/5

Sad to say but I think they have missed a trick here. 

As a massive fan of Blade Runner, when I heard they were making a VR movie tie in for BR 2049 I was jumping with glee in anticipation of playing it. Finally after a few delays I jumped in to explore the Blade Runner universe. What I discovered what a lifeless, souless world, devoid of any of the richness and depth we find in the Blade Runner films we know and love. 

Does it look like Blade Runner? Sort of... the Yukon Hotel is there. The Holo Ballerina from 2049 is dancing above you. Joi is selling herself on an advertising billboard as a few spinners hover past but it just feels so empty and lifeless. I could put it down to a few things but one easy fix would have been sound. They should have filled it with the bustling street sounds of LA 2049 or 2019 and added a few more npcs. 

The other thing is you don't get to fly a spinner except for an "on rails" moment at the start. It's not Blade Runner if you can't fly your own spinner. I mean come on!

I do applaud them for making the effort though and giving us a freebie but I would happily pay to have proper Blade Runner experience. This property is so ripe for VR.

Come on Warner Bros, give us what we all want.

Requrements GTX 1080 or greater.... Really
scam
I haven't even tried this yet but I'm giving it 5 stars for the Dev's response to pvdkuijt below :)
Amazing seeing holographic captures of human beings in action, reminds me of those old-school FMV games
it will not install
Hope also that you'll find a way to render compatible with WIN 7
I too would love to see this available for Win 7 / 8. Thx!
Walking around in the Blade Runner universe is a treat!
too bad :-(
review_feedback: Unfortunately due to the use of Microsoft Holographic technology that enabled us to do photogrammetry captures of our actors and actresses the minimum requirement is windows 10. We are working directly with Microsoft to see if there is a way to bring this experience to both windows 8.1 and 7. Please be on the look out for update which may enable this option.
